original_title: Sri Lanka’s NDB debenture issue oversubscribed
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The National Development Bank Plc (NDB) said that its issue of fifty million (50,000,000) debentures was oversubscribed.

The Basel III compliant, Tier 2 listed, rated, unsecured subordinated redeemable debentures with a non-viability conversion, at the par value of LKR 100 each, aimed to raise five billion rupees (LKR 5,000,0000000).

“We have received applications for over LKR 5,000,000,000 (five billion rupees) for the above Debenture Issue by National Development Bank PLC and accordingly the Issue has been oversubscribed,” the bank said in a statement.
The basis of allotment will be notified to the CSE in due course, the bank said.
The bank’s share price traded between 69.40-68.10, but mostly remained flat in the day’s trading. (Colombo/Dec6/2023)
